name: Zealand Mountain

trails_config.name: Zealand Trail to Twinway
trails_config.description: Passes through the beautiful Zealand Notch and past Zealand Falls Hut. While the summit is viewless, the nearby Zeacliff offers one of the most stunning vistas in the Whites.
trails_config.parking_info: Zealand Trailhead, Zealand Rd, Bethlehem, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Zealand Mountain rises to 4260 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4260 feet, Zealand Mountain is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Zealand Trail to Twinway**, a **11.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **South Twin Mountain**, which is just 1.8 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
